intro: Aspidopterys celebensis, commonly known as the Celebes aspidopterys, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features include a woody stem and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
